results.title: Bedlam  for Commodore 64 & 128
results.creator_credit: GO! Media Holdings Ltd and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: Bedlam [computer game]. Bedlam is a top down vertical shooting scroller in a futuristic sci fi setting for one or two players simultaneously. Players pilot a vehicle shooting and dodging aliens and fighting boss ships.

results.title: Asterix and the Magic Cauldron [Spectrum 48/128 emulation]
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description:
Asterix and the Magic Cauldron is a single player adventure arcade game. Players control Asterix through various maps, collecting keys for locked doors and fighting Romans and boars in search of seven pieces of Getafix’s Magic Cauldron. Fights take place on a separate screen mode. Stamina bars for each combatant appear on the side of the window. Defeating the combatant adds it to the food tally. If Asterix loses the fight, the window closes and he loses a life. The same system is used when fighting the Roman soldiers and when Asterix picks up objects.

Obelix will only follow if Asterix has a supply of hams which can be obtained from fighting boars. Asterix starts with five lives and one dose of Magic Potion per game, which can be activated by double tapping the fire button.

Original game developed by Beam Software for ZX Spectrum 48K, published in 1986 by Melbourne House.

Source: Play It Again website: http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/asterix-and-the-magic-cauldron/

Last accessed: 1/05/2021

results.title: America's Cup Challenge  for Amstrad
results.creator_credit: Armchair Entertainment, US Gold Pty Ltd and Micro Forte Studios
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and manual in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description:
America’s Cup Challenge is a one to two player competitive sports simulation. The included manual contains a lot of information about the America’s Cup including yachting terminology, race legs, wind angles, sails and weather conditions. The player controls the crew of a racing yacht using the joystick, chosing the type of sail at the start of the race and then switching between three different modes, helmsman, sails selection and winching. As Helmsman, players control the yacht’s direction. Sail selection allows players to move the angle of the sail’s boom and the level of use of the spinnaker or genoa. The manual advises the use of a good quality robust joystick.

Source: Play It Again website: http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/arnies-americas-cup-challenge/
Last accessed: 14/04/2021

Original game developed by Micro Forté Pty. Ltd. for Commodore 64, published by Electronic Arts (USA) and U.S. Gold (Europe) in 1986.

results.title: We Dream of Networks
results.credit_line:
Jess Johnson
Limited edition print
ACMI Collection
results.material_description: giclée print on archival quality cotton rag with four deckled edges, edition 40/50
results.brief_description:
Jess Johnson was born in Aotearoa/New Zealand in 1979, and lives and works in New York. Her drawing and installation practice is influenced by science fiction, language, culture and technology. In her drawings she depicts complex worlds that combine densely layered patterns, objects and figures within architectural settings. Johnson’s drawings are often displayed within constructed environments that act as physical portals into her speculative worlds. Her video collaborations with Simon Ward have involved translating her drawings into animated Virtual Reality, thus enabling her audience to have the simulated experience of entering the hypnotic realms depicted in her drawings. Jess Johnson’s work has been exhibited Internationally in solo exhibitions at; Jack Hanley Gallery, New York; Art Basel, Hong Kong; Nanzuka Gallery, Tokyo; Talbot Rice Gallery, Edinburgh; National Gallery of Australia; Museum of Contemporary Art, Australia; Auckland Art Gallery and Christchurch Art Gallery, New Zealand.

Jess Johnson is represented by Darren Knight Gallery, Sydney; Ivan Anthony Gallery, Auckland and Jack Hanley Gallery, New York

results.title: Touch the Sun : The Gift (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Nicos and Sofia, two city kids, strike it lucky in a lottery. Their prize is five hundred hectares of beautiful bushland in Western Australia. Together with their grandfather the children travel west to discover the mystery and magic of their land. However the children discover a darker side to their new found fortune.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Princess Kate (K)
results.creator_credit: George Ogilvie, Antonia Barnard, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Thirteen year old Kate’s world is turned tospy turvy when she learns she is adopted. Unaware of the pain she is causing her adoptive family, Kate searches for her “real” parents. Her unexpected arrival on the doorstep of her natural mother stirs up mixed emotions. Kate succeeds in befriending her half-sister May before returning home to her adoptive parents with a new understanding of herself and her relationships. Cast includes Justine Clark, Lyndel Rowe, Alan Cassel, Myra Noblet, Shane Tickner, Rebeh Elmalog Lou, Lorna Lesley, Martin Sacks, Mouche Phillips, Claudia Karvan, Beth Buchanan. Written by Kristin and David Williamson.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno (K)
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness, his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Cast includes: Damien Walters - Captain Johnno Rebecca Sykes - Julie Michelle Fawdon - Kathleen Joe Petruzzi - Tony Written by Rob George, music by Stephen Matters. Rated G.

results.title: Touch the Sun : Devil's Hill (K)
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Jill Robb and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Top enders (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Alice, a runaway from home, meets on the road Nick, an Aboriginal boy in pursuit of his uncle. Stealing a car they traverse a treacherous stretch of desert road. When the car runs out of petrol they set out on foot, only to become lost. With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival, Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and their families from which they have fled.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jackie McKimmie, Jill Robb and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

With the harsh desert conditions threatening their survival, Alice and Mick reflect on their actions and their families from which they have fled.
